alert.note: Alert for Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 8:17PM EDT until May 22 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Crawford and Erie. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 817 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Erie, Conneaut, Edinboro, North East, Girard, Cambridge Springs, Waterford, Albion, Linesville, Wattsburg, Harmonsburg, Northwest Harborcreek, Pymatuning North, Atlantic, Adamsville, Pymatuning Central, Harborcreek, Lawrence Park, Wesleyville and Lake City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
